Yes, because soundwaves by nature are measured through our environment. As =
RJ corrected and reminded me they are pressure waves that are subject to th=
e thickness of our atmosphere. Meaning they cannot be transmitted at th spe=
ed of light. What they can do is be embedded in a carrier signal to be demo=
dulated by the air and manifest back into physical sound.
=A0
FRank R

ect: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas








Sorry, RJ. I stand corrected! Soundwav=
es are not EM waves because they lack the EM component and are subject to o=
ur physical environment. Hence, cannot travel at the speed of light. 
=A0
T=
hat being said, the heterodyne theory still stands. LOL
=A0
Frank R.

--- O=
n Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wrote:

Tell me wher=
e the seperation on the spectrum takes place between 300Hz and 300KHz. Yes,=
 soundwaves cause pressure waves that our ears read as vibration and our mi=
nd translates as sound. The waves are still on the electromagnetic spectrum=
. Even subsonic geomagnetic waves are present on the scale. What I mean by =
power can be directll translated to volume or amplitude. The only thing tha=
t distinguishes soundwaves from any other wave is the fact that we can hear=
 them.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


=
From: Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:53 PM








No. Sounds wa=
ves are not on the electromagnet spectrum nor are they a form of electromag=
net energy. Sound waves are based on pressure waves in the air (or in other=
 substances).=A0 Our ears detect these pressure waves and translate them in=
to sounds we here.=A0 Our ear do NOT hear electromagnet energy.=A0 Our eyes=
 do: that part which we call visible light.



--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ra=
tka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wrote:


From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yah=
oo.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date:=
 Monday, June 8, 2009, 12:38 PM









It sounds like she's saying "one, =
two, ....."
=A0
A mistake that a lot of people make is thinking that there =
are two different types of energy at work when it comes to sound waves and =
electromagnetic waves. The only thing that seperates them is frequency and =
power. Radio waves are radio waves because they occupy a certain block of t=
he electromagnietic spectrum. Sound waves exist on that same spectrum just =
farther down with much longer waves. Soundwaves and subsonic waves can pene=
trate almost anything because of their wavelengths. The shorter the wavelen=
gth the more ways we can shield against them.
=A0
Think of microwaves. Thes=
e are also a type of radio and telemetry transmitting wave but the waves al=
so have a physical effect on our environment by causing molecules to speed =
up, which creates heat. A little lower than this is IR or infrared it too c=
an cause physical objects to heat up but usually it just causes molecules t=
o rotate in place. All physical things give off IR light. Its a way the tot=
al system conserves energy by spontaneously emitting IR radiation.
=A0
Fran=
k R.

h. com> wrote:


From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. =
com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas [3 Attachments]

ps .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM





Here is some food for thou=
ght. I am currently reviewing my audio from our May 30th investigation.
=A0=

It was me and another girl teammate=A0present in the room. I picked up a 3=
rd female voice on my digital voice recorder that I carry with me. We were =
standing right next to another digital video recorder that I leave beside m=
y night vision camera. That recorder did not pick up this 3rd voice. I have=
 asked the girl that was with me to check her recording to see if she picke=
d it up.
=A0
I have long felt the true EVP does not come from sound waves i=
n the environment, or then it wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodied voice. Som=
ehow EVP's are appearing directly on the recordings.
=A0
This instance with=
 the recorders may back that theory up. That other recorder should have pic=
ked that voice up if it were sound waves in the environment.
=A0
I am attac=
hing the clip of this 3rd voice. The=A0file that is named=A0"01-02-17 Clip"=
 is the full clip.=A0You will hear my voice as I say "Yeah", and then anoth=
er comes in right after that. I think I know what it says.
=A0
Again, I was=
 live monitoring my audio, but still did not hear this until playback. It i=
sn't clear, so I am not as excited about it as my one's from the last inves=
tigation.
=A0
=A0

----- Original Message ----- 
From: Frank Ratka 
To: EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:09 PM
Subject: Re: [EV=
P-ITC] New ideas








I have a running theory that EVP is carried on an =
untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to manifest. It =
works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that di=
ffer one another in frequency then if you add or subtract them together you=
 get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if a ghost is se=
nding a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room creating an =
untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate difference=
=A0frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This=
 was just an example, but all electronic equipment generates ultrasonic sig=
nals just by turning them on. From this theory I always felt that EVP were =
generated within a few inches of the recorder.
=A0
We are able to reproduce=
 this affect in not only radio with superheterodyne systems but also with a=
coustics and audio as in some passive sonars and a commercial produce calle=
d the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.
=A0
Frank R.

hat the EVP are often=A0not recorded by the microphone but somehow make the=
ir way in at the actual=A0point where the storage is made, whether it be an=
alog (tape) or digital.=A0

So much we don't know ...
=A0
Zack

=A0

 Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch=

I monitor my audio live. The funny thing is that eve=
n so, those last EVP's I captured I did not hear either in the environment,=
 or on my recording as it happened. I only heard them upon playback.
=A0


=

From: Zack Widup 

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .c=
om 



Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM

s




I am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote site has e=
ver gotten any EVP in real time.
=A0
I=A0took part in=A0an investigation of=
 Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six video came=
ras set up in the three halls of the building. The video for all=A0was bein=
g monitored and recorded=A0at a central location. Alas, we did not have mic=
rophones at the camera sites conected to the central location. I wonder wha=
t we might have heard if we did?
=A0
Zack

<TD vAlign=3Dtop>
<DIV>I have a runn=
ing theory that EVP is carried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactl=
y where they want it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. If=
 you mix two ultrasonic waves that differ one another in frequency then if =
you add or subtract them together you get a beat frequency or alternate fre=
quency. For example, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have a=
n electric fan in a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you=
 will have a intermediate difference frequency at 9KHz, well within hu=
man hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all electr=
onic equipment generates ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From t=
his theory I always felt that EVP were generated within a few inches of the=
 recorder.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>We are able to reproduce this affec=
t in not only radio with superheterodyne systems but also with acoustics an=
d audio as in some passive sonars and a commercial produce called the "audi=
o spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>

<DIV>I am curious if anyone =
with a microphone wired to a remote site has ever gotten any EVP in real ti=
me.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>I took part in an investigation =
of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six video ca=
meras set up in the three halls of the building. The video for all was=
 being monitored and recorded at a central location. Alas, we did not =
have microphones at the camera sites conected to the central location. I wo=
nder what we might have heard if we did?</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>Zack<=
